title: Panda Express Menu website not displaying properly on Firefox Desktop
content:
Hi there,

Iâ€™m having trouble viewing the Panda Express Menu page correctly on Firefox Desktop. The page layout looks broken â€” images are misplaced, and some buttons or sections donâ€™t respond when I click them. However, the same page loads normally on Chrome and Edge.

Hereâ€™s what Iâ€™ve tried:

Cleared cache and cookies

Disabled all extensions and ad blockers

Tested in Firefox Troubleshoot Mode (issue still there)

Updated Firefox to the latest version

Tried disabling Enhanced Tracking Protection

Even after doing all this, the Panda Express Menu webpage still doesnâ€™t render correctly. It looks like certain CSS files or JavaScript elements arenâ€™t loading as expected.

Could this be related to mixed content blocking or a compatibility issue in the latest version of Firefox? Any suggestions or settings I can check to fix this?

title: Printing option "scale" doesn't work
content: Hi, I recently switched to Firefox and I have run into a problem. While printing a pdf on the "more setting" menu the percentage scale doesn't actually work. First of all the preview doesn't change when trying different scales, I thought that it might have been a preview problem and I've tried to print anyway finding out that also the printed result wasn't correct. title: Will I face occasional screen glitches in firefox just like in chrome?
content: Hi Firefox team, I recently switched from Chrome to Firefox due to a recurring issue I noticed on my HP Omnibook laptop (productivity-focused, iGPU,). While watching YouTube videos in Chrome or Edge, I occasionally see a brief (0.1 second) black-and-white glitch near the top of the screen â€” but only when the video quality changes (e.g., auto-switching or manual resolution change). It never happens during regular browsing or local video playback. Iâ€™m testing Firefox now and wondering: - Does Firefox handle video stream transitions differently than Chromium-based browsers? - Is hardware acceleration in Firefox less prone to triggering such micro-glitches? - Any recommended settings or flags to optimize video playback stability in Firefox? - I was hoping to see an option to turn of AV1 video codec (if possible) Iâ€™m not gaming or doing heavy rendering â€” just casual productivity and media use. And I have switched on the default performance settings from my firefox browser setting. Would love to know if Firefox is better suited for this kind of smooth, glitch-free experience. Thanks in advance!

title: Spellcheck sometimes randomises language
content: I usually want spellchecks "English (United kingdom, large)" and "German (Germany)" active. Every few days to weeks it changes to a (single) random other language instead, like "German (Luxembourg)". Posts I've found elsewhere suggest changing display language (which should be unrelated and is already set to UK English), uninstalling all other dictionaries system-wide (which should not be necessary and is not acceptable), reinstalling Firefox entirely (but that's for cases where the correct dictionary was never selectable, I can select it, it just doesn't stay for long) or issues with syncing with other devices (but I don't change that setting on other devices, either). How do I stop spellcheck from changing and why does this even happen?
creator: fabianroeling

title: "open image in new tab" issue
content:

title: constant intermittent ytube 153 errors
content:

Even clearing the profile cache and history has unpredictable effect. The web is full of questions to this very issue with no definitive fix. It appears Firefox is not clearing things out properly even though the profile settings are set to delete everything upon exit.

What is the fix?? (or is there one?) A very frustrated longtime user.
